issue.title: Skip func type value in fields.
issue.body:
We skip those unprintable fields and an error field
instead of dropping the whole trace.

Fixes #642

issue.title: Handle JSON func values
issue.body: Leave func handling up to the formatter.

issue.title: Error marshalling JSON when Panic() is called and JSONFormatter used
issue.body:
I'm using JSONFormatter and calling logrus.Panic("panic msg") which gives me this error:

`Failed to obtain reader, Failed to marshal fields to JSON, json: unsupported type: logrus.exitFunc`

If I add a Marshaler interface for logrus.extFunc that just returns "<func pointer>", it works, but this involves modifying logrus vendor code. This seems related to  #835 and #642. 

I don't really care about handling type-functions as field values in general--I just want to be able to call Panic()--this seems like a bug, but I fully admit I could be missing something and doing something wrong.

issue.title: Skip func pointer type value in fields
issue.body:
Before there was introduced a fix for JSONFormatter when func type value
passed as Field. This commit does the same but for pointer to func.

Ref:
https://github.com/sirupsen/logrus/issues/642
https://github.com/sirupsen/logrus/pull/832

issue.title: Failed to obtain reader in the logs

repository.name: lookout
repository.description: Assisted code review, running custom code analyzers on pull requests

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
```
Failed to obtain reader, Failed to marshal fields to JSON, json: unsupported type: func(io.Reader)
```

this error isn't formatted as json, so I guess the error happens during logging.

issue.title: Unsupported type func ...
JSON based logging not applied everywhere

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: This is a bug in the Cilium logic.

body:
I am still seeing this issue  in v1.7.0

Test Code:
`log.SetFormatter(&log.JSONFormatter{})`
 `req,_ := http.NewRequest("POST", "127.0.0.1",nil)`
`log.WithFields(log.Fields{
		"req":    req,
	}).Error("new request failed")`

Output:`Failed to obtain reader, failed to marshal fields to JSON, json: unsupported type: func() (io.ReadCloser, error)`

Today I came across the same error for a struct which has a function as a field type. As a workaround, a tag can be added to the field, so that this is not taken into account for the JSON,  `json:"-"`.
If you are logging HTTP request/response, use `httputil.DumpRequest`/ `httputil.DumpResponse` instead of `zap.Any`
